description: A heavy protective coat worn by firefighters, highly resistant to heat and flame.
A piece of clerical clothing, usually worn by Christian priests.
A fur coat with a couple small pockets.  Extremely warm.
A garishly-colored faux fur coat with a couple small pockets.  Although not as warm as natural fur, it gives you some of that unique flair.
A very well-made fur coat, featuring thick panels of sable fur.  Very warm and very good-looking.
A long white coat with several large pockets.  Comes with a very nice pocket protector.
A plastic coat with a hood and two very large pockets, meant to provide protection from rain.
A lightweight plastic rain poncho with a hood.  It folds into a very compact form when not in use.
A bulky traditional Japanese raincoat made from straw, which covers the entire body.  Also known as mino.
An intricately sewn coat of treated and split intestines, prized for its light weight and waterproof qualities among the indigenous peoples of the arctic.
A padded coat with deep pockets and a hood.  Very warm.
A rugged full-length duster coat.  Has many pockets for storage.
A thick fur full-length duster.  Has many pockets for storage.
A thick faux fur duster, falling below your knees.  Has many pockets for storing things.
A thick leather full-length duster.  Has many pockets for storage.
A heavy, full-length wool coat.  Cumbersome, but warm and with deep pockets.
Plain black hakama for use in kendo and other martial arts.
A flowing, pleated garment which can be worn over a kimono.
An outer garment of absorbent, towel-like material traditionally worn to cover one's nakedness to and from the bath.  It makes you wish you had running water to bathe with.
A vintage army jacket, or at least a copy of one, with lots of pockets.  Favored by the military.
A sleek blouse in a camouflage pattern with angled breast pockets and lots of loop velcro for affixing patches.  You might call it a jacket but it's really a blouse.  It has a pocket for your pen!
A double-breasted uniform to protect against the heat of the kitchen.

variants.description: It's colored white, the most common color for chef's jackets.
It's colored black, commonly used by chefs working in the night or who just want to look cool.
It's colored pink, commonly used by women chefs or men who like pink.
It has a camouflage pattern, perfect for chefs that want to hide in the wild.
It's colored white, and the front and back are printed with a giant skull between crossed kitchen knives.  Perfect for the apocalyptic chef.

description: A bright, cheaply made FEMA-issue windbreaker jacket with a hood.  One size, fits none.  Helps keep you unfrozen & visible for rescuers.
A jacket made from flannel-style denim, favored by outdoorsy types.
A jacket made from denim.

snippet_category.text: A jacket made from denim.  This one is haphazardly covered with patches featuring metal band logos.

description: This is a wrap over black jacket.  Commonly used by stealthy individuals hiding in the dark of the night.  It includes a pair of cotton gauntlets and a sash.
A jacket made from thick leather.  Offers more protection than your average jacket.
A candy-apple-red leather jacket with black strips and shoulder protrusions.  It has a number of zippers and snaps in the front.
A thin cotton jacket with a hood.  Good for brisk weather.
A light synthetic jacket with a hood.  Not very warm, but will keep out the rain.
Plain white judo gi.
Plain white karate gi.  Made from loose and flowing cotton.
A traditional, ankle-length Shinto robe with several layers and very wide sleeves.
A traditional, ankle-length Buddhist robe, stitched together from three pieces of traditional saffron dyed cloth.
Plain white keikogi for use in martial arts.
A traditional, ankle-length Japanese robe, wrapped around the body with a sash.
An easy-to-wear, breezy robe secured with a sash.  Essentially Japanese pajamas.  Great for summer nights.
A loose coat with wide sleeves that is worn unfastened over a kimono.  It is jet black with sparse, tasteful golden embroidery.
A white, knee-length cotton robe, traditionally worn by Jews on special occasions.
A thick and heavy leather jacket emblazoned with the insignia of the local police force.
A heavy wool coat, warm and with deep pockets.
A loose-fitting outer garment with sleeves and a mysterious amount of well-hidden pockets.
A white hooded ghost's robe characteristic of souls that haunt the living world.
A cheap ghost costume comprised of a white sheet with two eye holes cut out.  A simple hat is worn underneath to keep the sheet in place.
A black hooded grim reaper's robe with a face cover to hide the user's lack of facial skin.  It pairs nicely with a scythe.  Use it to remove the face cover and show yourself before your victims.

use_action.msg: The darkness surrounding your face lightens.

description: A black hooded grim reaper's robe with the face cover removed to show user's lack of facial skin.  It pairs nicely with a scythe.  Use it to hide your lack of facial features.
//: 'Faceless' as in 'face cover'less and because, without the cover of darkness (A black face cover) a real grim reaper would really be faceless

use_action.msg: You shroud your face in darkness.

description: A mysterious and arcane-looking robe, signifying status in the wizarding world.  It has a hood and some pockets for your magical artifacts.
A traditional, double-layered Buddhist coat.  Used as an outer cloak for various occasions.
A red jacket, trimmed with white faux fur, commonly used by bearded men on Christmas.  Warm and has a couple of small pockets.
A short red jacket with white faux fur as trim, similar to a Santa jacket but sleeveless, for a more revealing look on Christmas.
An insulated, breathable hoodie made for alpine skiing.  Very warm, and with sizable pockets.

//: The general guideline for sleeveless dusters is the components, volume, weight, time to craft, and value are 15% lower (rounded down) than the original.  Making it from an original takes 50% the time.
description: A rugged full-length duster that leaves your arms unencumbered.  Has plenty of storage space due to its many pockets.

//: The general guideline for sleeveless dusters is the components, volume, weight, time to craft, and value are 15% lower (rounded down) than the original.  Making it from an original takes 50% the time.
description: A thick fur full-length duster without sleeves, leaving your arms unencumbered.  Has plenty of storage space due to its many pockets.
A thick, sleeveless faux fur duster, falling below your knees.  Has many pockets for storing things.

//: The general guideline for sleeveless dusters is the components, volume, weight, time to craft, and value are 15% lower (rounded down) than the original.  Making it from an original takes 50% the time.
description: A thick leather full-length duster without sleeves, leaving your arms unencumbered.  Has plenty of storage space due to its many pockets.

//: The general guideline for sleeveless trenchcoats is the components, volume, weight, time to craft, and value are 15% lower (rounded down) than the original.  Making it from an original takes 50% the time.
description: A thick canvas trenchcoat that leaves your arms unencumbered.  Has plenty of storage space due to its many pockets.

//: The general guideline for sleeveless trenchcoats is the components, volume, weight, time to craft, and value are 15% lower (rounded down) than the original.  Making it from an original takes 50% the time.
description: A thick fur trenchcoat without sleeves, leaving your arms unencumbered.  Has plenty of storage space due to its many pockets.
A thick faux fur trenchcoat without sleeves.  Has plenty of storage space, and looks pretty good.

//: The general guideline for sleeveless trenchcoats is the components, volume, weight, time to craft, and value are 15% lower (rounded down) than the original.  Making it from an original takes 50% the time.
description: A thick leather trenchcoat without sleeves, leaving your arms unencumbered.  Has plenty of storage space due to its many pockets.
A sleeveless cloth garment that covers the torso and legs.
A long, loose-fitting robe with wide sleeves.  A traditional Arab garment.
A thick canvas trenchcoat, lined with pockets.  Great for storage.
A thick fur trenchcoat, lined with pockets.  Great for storage.
A thick faux fur trenchcoat, lined with pockets.  Great for storage, and makes you the talk of the town.
A thick leather trenchcoat, lined with pockets.  Great for storage.
A simple garment long enough to cover down to the knees.
A poorly-made long tunic with a string tied around the waist to keep it all in place.
A full-body tuxedo.  Makes the apocalypse feel a little more classy.
An elegant waistcoat.  Ideal for those occasions when wearing only a shirt would be too casual and a suit would be overdoing it.
A hooded jacket with lots of pockets, thickly padded for warmth.  Favored by the military.
